results.content: This well structured course teaches you everything you need to know to work confidently with Razor Pages.
results.content_html: This well structured course teaches you everything you need to know to work confidently with Razor Pages.

results.content: I have to say...Great teacher, great relaxing voice, solid English, good instruction...on basic features. This is NOT a "master ASP.net Core Razor Page" class (this really upsets me as its misleading). This is a discussion on the "out of the box" functionality...with a nugget here and there worth noting. There is nothing on components, partial views, drop down controls, handling images, security abstraction (uses canned implementation), error handling, etc... I get more watching YouTube user 'kudvenkat' for free. I'm confused with things like including "ApplicationDbContext _dbContext" in the constructor when UserManager<IdentityUser> userManager will get you what you want. Or the lack of using interfaces consistently with dependency injection. Nothing on model binding, minimal on validation, nothing on callbacks, temp data, OMG I could go on and on...Its basically a discussion on the code Visual studio templates already generates for you. Watch YouTube IAmTimCorey Intro to ASP.NET Core Razor Pages - From Start to Published for free. :-| I really expected MUCH more for my money.
results.content_html: I have to say...Great teacher, great relaxing voice, solid English, good instruction...on basic features. This is NOT a "master ASP.net Core Razor Page" class (this really upsets me as its misleading). This is a discussion on the "out of the box" functionality...with a nugget here and there worth noting. There is nothing on components, partial views, drop down controls, handling images, security abstraction (uses canned implementation), error handling, etc... I get more watching YouTube user 'kudvenkat' for free. I'm confused with things like including "ApplicationDbContext _dbContext" in the constructor when UserManager userManager will get you what you want. Or the lack of using interfaces consistently with dependency injection. Nothing on model binding, minimal on validation, nothing on callbacks, temp data, OMG I could go on and on...Its basically a discussion on the code Visual studio templates already generates for you. Watch YouTube IAmTimCorey Intro to ASP.NET Core Razor Pages - From Start to Published for free. :-| I really expected MUCH more for my money.

results.content: The course is exactly right for my current level of understanding - I have been able to follow and understand everything, and to apply what I've learnt to projects outside the course.  I am moving to ASP.NET Core after many years developing desktop applications and have tried some other online courses before this one - I found that these expected a depth of web programming knowledge that I don't yet have, whereas this one assumes little prior experience but still manages to cover all the basic requirements.  Learning was made easier by the choice of sample applications.  Both the book and garage examples contained code that can be applied to a variety of other projects, whereas some other courses I've tried concentrated too much on fancy layouts and images at the cost of obscuring the boilerplate code common to most real-life applications.

response.content: Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback! It is always encouraging to see the positive feedback!
response.content_html: Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback! It is always encouraging to see the positive feedback!

results.content:
Thus for this course has exceeded my expectations.  It is really good.  I am learning more than Razor pages! I am sharpening my BS4, JavaScript, ASPNET Core, and EntityFramework Core Skills.  I am also learning new short cuts in Visual Studio.

I was struggling to understand the differences in using Razor Pages vs MVC.  This course definitely assisted me in understanding what I needed to gain an understanding of the differences.  In addition, the course provided valuable resources that were not known to me.  These resources will definitely help me completed my project own time and publish it sooner than expected.
results.content_html:
Thus for this course has exceeded my expectations. It is really good. I am learning more than Razor pages! I am sharpening my BS4, JavaScript, ASPNET Core, and EntityFramework Core Skills. I am also learning new short cuts in Visual Studio.

In addition, the course provided valuable resources that were not known to me. These resources will definitely help me completed my project own time and publish it sooner than expected.

results.content: As always with Bhrugen, they are clear well delivered and with a real life example that give the course real context, so you understand the thought patterns with regards where to start building the site and structure for working your way through the different elements require to complete the site. During the course he doesn't hide mistakes etc, but goes through fault finding also he covers debugging and alternative ways of doing things. he also always answers question that you post! Very Highly Recommended.

results.content: Two years ago I made the switch from ASP.NET Web Forms using CodeBehind to needing to learn ASP.NET Core MVC and now Razor Pages. Don't spend the countless hours of searching the web and youtube for learning material on ASP.NET Core MVC or Razor Pages. Do yourself the favor and just purchase Bhrugen's Courses. I have every Course of his and I have learned so much. I recently created my first application for a client and could NOT have done it if it wasn't for Bhrugen's Courses. He is a very pationate Developer and is an amazing teacher. Bhrugen takes his time and explains every detail. Please trust me, you will NOT be disappointed....
